title: Cosmetic Acupuncture
description: Cosmetic acupuncture is the method of applying needles to achieve aesthetic benefits. Schedule with Phonexay Lala Simon at Rebel Med NW in Ballard, Seattle.
cleaned_text: What is Cosmetic Acupuncture? Acupuncture Aesthetics Cosmetic acupuncture is the method of applying needles to achieve benefits of circulation, detoxification, and more efficient repair. It is different than regular acupuncture because the needles only penetrate 3mm deep! At this depth, we target the dermal layer: the elastin and collagen matrix just beneath the skin. Cosmetic Acupuncture focuses more on lifting, firming, and tightening skin, as well as reducing inflammation and increasing collagen production. Both methods are based on Chinese Medicine principles of moving Qi and blood and stimulating facial meridians. Cosmetic Acupuncture takes 6-10 treatments to achieve lasting results. Many people find benefit in an additional single treatment as maintenance when seasons change or before an event. Pricing Structure Add-on to Acupuncture $50 - Single cosmetic treatment includes: - Constitutional balancing - Astragalus & Ginseng cleanse - Needling protocol - Massage with Mei Zen Cosmetics herbal oil - Nutrition and Self-Care guide - No commitments - Great if you're new to acupuncture! - Five cosmetic treatments include: - Constitutional balancing - Astragalus & Ginseng cleanse - Needling protocol - Massage with Mei Zen Cosmetics herbal oil - Nutrition and Self-Care guide - Sample of massage oil for Self-Care - 10% savings! - Ten cosmetic treatments include: - Constitutional balancing - Astragalus & Ginseng cleanse - Needling protocol - Massage with Mei Zen Cosmetics herbal oil - Nutrition and Self-Care guide - Sample of massage oil for Self-Care - 15% savings! Acupuncture Aesthetic Services Consider pairing Cosmetic Acupuncture with [Bio-Injections](https://rebelmednw.com/aesthetics/bio-injections/) or [Micro-Needling](https://rebelmednw.com/aesthetics/microneedling/)/ [Nano-Needling](https://rebelmednw.com/aesthetics/nano-needling/). Bio-injections help infuse resources into the dermal matrix while the Cosmetic Acupuncture tells the body how to use those resources in the form of a controlled inflammation process. With Micro-Needling, you are not penetrating as deep of a layer. Micro-needling is a comprehensive exfoliation method that helps to reveal new skin to the surface. Nano-needling is even finer and more superficial. For best results, consult with a provider to come up with a plan for your specific skin, constitution, and age. [Bio-Injections](https://rebelmednw.com/aesthetics/bio-injections/) When paired with Cosmetic Acupuncture, this treatment is as close to botox as a natural treatment can get! Instead of botulinum, we use homeopathics and herbs to help support skin detoxification and reconstruction. Micro-Needling / Nano-Needling As a deep "resurfacing" type of treatment, [Micro](https://rebelmednw.com/aesthetics/microneedling/) & [Nano](https://rebelmednw.com/aesthetics/nano-needling/)-Needling is a comprehensive exfoliation process. Apple-stem cells are paired with Hyaluronic Acid and Chinese Medicine herbs to create specialized serums for each client depending on their needs. Our skin absorbs the stem cells and nutrients from the herbs and utilizes these resources in its repair and reconstruction process. Cosmetic Cupping & Guasha As a popular Add-On, Cosmetic Cupping and Guasha are ancient massage techniques that stimulate circulation and help release muscle tension. When applied to the face, it generally helps to round out your skincare regimen at Rebel Med NW. If you get your own set of tools, our providers can teach you tips and techniques for giving yourself an at-home facial massage. Acupuncture Aesthetic Treatments for All Ages Cosmetic Acupuncture in your 20s & 30s In your 20s and 30s, you may not be thinking about your skin much, but there's a lot that acupuncture and Cosmetic Acupuncture has to offer. First of all, if you have great skin, keep it great and healthy by maintaining a facial regimen. You can prolong the life of your skin by being proactive now. Secondly, if you suffer from acne, acupuncture - in general - can be a great treatment strategy as it addresses skin health from a holistic approach. If you are in your 20s, you will benefit from cosmetic acupuncture as a preventative process that will help your skin stay optimal throughout its lifetime. Begin fighting against sun damage now. The best use is after harsh seasons like winters and summers when skin suffers a lot of damage from sun and weather. If you are in your 30s, you will experience your skin looking brighter and more even, your pores are less noticeable, and the beginnings of lines and wrinkles diminish. The best use is seasonally, but at least after summers and winters. Cosmetic Acupuncture in your 40s & 50s The needs of people in their 40s and 50s are unique. This is when we're likely heavily involved in life, from raising kids to becoming leaders in our careers. Our stories come out in our faces: lack of sleep, subpar nutrition, lots of happy hours! For those of you in your 40s, you will experience rejuvenation in the form of smoother texture, softened fine lines and wrinkles, and plumper, brighter, more even skin tone. The best use is seasonal to monthly. Those in your 50s will experience a more even look, softer lines, and wrinkles, while your skin becomes more plump and tight, and brighter from increased blood circulation, detoxification, and repair. The best use is monthly or every other month. Cosmetic Acupuncture for 60s & Onward In your 60s and up, you are much more comfortable and confident in your own skin. Give it the TLC it needs and deserves by revitalizing it with some Cosmetic Acupuncture. For the fabulous 60s and older, you will experience varying degrees of skin-plumping and tightening, softening of fine lines, and lightening of various spots and blemishes. You may also have specific areas that you want to target, and although we cannot guarantee targeted results, we can still focus our treatments accordingly. When utilizing Cosmetic Acupuncture for a specific goal, we usually recommend a regular weekly series of 6 or 10 treatments. Once you get the desired results, you can follow a seasonal or monthly regimen of single treatments. Upgrade your Cosmetic Acupuncture protocols with Bio-Injections or an add-on Glutathione IV to support regeneration and detox. Find Your Zen with Cosmetic Needling Are there any side effects to Cosmetic Acupuncture? There are minimal risks and side effects associated with cosmetic acupuncture because the needle does not insert as deep as with traditional acupuncture. The main side effect that might be experienced is bruising and this is minimized by the use of refined needling technique and Arnica gel. In fact, many side effects of cosmetic acupuncture, much like conventional acupuncture, are actually positive! The beauty of cosmetic acupuncture is that you're becoming healthier from the inside out because every treatment comes with internal constitutional balancing based on traditional Chinese medicine principles because, in Chinese medicine, the only way to get healthier is from the inside out. You will get a protocol of acupuncture, nutrition advice and support, and lifestyle advice and support according to your level of health and your health and beauty goals.
